title: Further Meta Poems to The Decadent Review for Consideration: So Light Plants Its Root, Remains on the Planetary Surface, & Remains on the Cloud Plaza

history.message:
Hi James,

Thank you for your interest in The Decadent Review. We have received your submission and look forward to reviewing it.

Thanks!
-The Decadent Review

Dear James,

I've sent you an email to the address as it's registered at Submittable. Those sometimes end up in the junk folder, for whatever reason, so please check that, too.

Thank you,

D.

Dear James Grabill,

Congratulations! This message confirms the acceptance of your submission to The Decadent Review.

Thanks again.
Sincerely,
Dimitri Kaufman
The Decadent Review

Dear James,

As I've written to you in an email (perhaps it's in the junk folder?):

>> Thank you for the new submission. They’re fantastic.

I particularly liked the "So Light Plants Its Root” series, with the Rothko, Klee, Pollock, Graves refractions. It’s interesting both conceptually and corporeally, with the stanzas striking hard. It’s a pleasure to read.

Here’s a private link to an online draft: https://thedecadentreview.com/corpus/so-light-plants-its-root/

We’re trying to conform to the copyright restrictions, so I have a Klee’s “Hesitation" as top art, with the others being a bit too strict for us (otherwise I would have probably included the other masters in the piece as it unfolds - alas we’ll have to settle for that Klee).

Please let me know what you think.

As for the other poems, we can slowly trickle those in in the next months.
